medical_history.chief_complaint: A 52-year-old woman with sudden onset of tingling and numbness in arms, impaired speech, and difficulty swallowing.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began five days prior with tingling and numbness, improved for 24 hours, but then worsened to include difficulty swallowing and slurred speech, leading to an inability to speak. The day before presentation, she experienced bilateral impairment of the left visual field and lethargy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Renal transplantation 13 years ago for end-stage renal disease due to IgA nephropathy; history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia; treated for tuberculous peritonitis post-transplant.
